title: Type City
content: I recently spotted this: a city made of type. [http://www.veer.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020041627/http:/www.veer.com/ "http://www.veer.com/"). I love it - it's a good way to wile away a few minutes if you're bored or looking for inspiration. I am happy to see a couple of mine in there too; in The Bringhurst Hotel and City Hall.
author: Nick Cooke

comments.content: Hey Nick! I agree. I just saw the [Typecity](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020041627/http:/www.veer.com/ideas/typecity/gallery.aspx) and I am in love with that and now I want to live in the [Burgues](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020041627/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000267) castle! hahaha
I was quite taken with Hutchinson House myself. \>^p

Very nice stuff!

More tasteful habitable typography:  
 [http://www.nofont.com/section\_experiments/index.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020041627/http:/www.nofont.com/section_experiments/index.asp "http://www.nofont.com/section\_experiments/index.asp")  
See "Urban communication" (but all the others too).

hhp

Alejandro - you really went to town on those flourishes didn't you? very beautiful.

Nick Cooke
